## Cpp-linter Review
Only 1 out of 4 clang-format suggestions fit within this pull request's diff.

<details><summary>Click here for the full clang-format patch</summary>


```diff
diff --git a/src/demo.cpp b/src/demo.cpp
index fc295c3..c522998 100644
--- a/src/demo.cpp
+++ b/src/demo.cpp
@@ -4,9 +4,7 @@
 
+int main()
+{
 
-
-
-int main(){
-
-    for (;;) break;
-
+    for (;;)
+        break;
 
@@ -14,5 +12,3 @@ int main(){
 
-
-
-
-    return 0;}
+    return 0;
+}
diff --git a/src/demo.hpp b/src/demo.hpp
index a429f5c..8f92cac 100644
--- a/src/demo.hpp
+++ b/src/demo.hpp
@@ -7,25 +7,12 @@ class Dummy {
     int numb;
-    Dummy() :numb(0), useless("\0"){}
+    Dummy()
+        : numb(0)
+        , useless("\0")
+    {
+    }
 
     public:
-    void *not_useful(char *str){useless = str;}
+        void* not_useful(char* str) { useless = str; }
 };
 
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
 struct LongDiff
@@ -33,4 +20,3 @@ struct LongDiff
 
-    long diff;
-
+        long diff;
 };

```


</details>

Only 2 out of 3 clang-tidy suggestions fit within this pull request's diff.

<details><summary>Click here for the full clang-tidy patch</summary>


```diff

index fc295c3..b160609 100644
--- a/src/demo.cpp
+++ b/src/demo.cpp
@@ -2,11 +2,10 @@
 #include "demo.hpp"
-#include <stdio.h>
+#include <cstdio>
 
+auto main() -> int
+{
 
-
-
-int main(){
-
-    for (;;) break;
-
+    for (;;) {
+        break;
+    }
 
@@ -17,2 +16,3 @@ int main(){
 
-    return 0;}
+    return 0;
+}
diff --git a/src/demo.hpp b/src/demo.hpp
index a429f5c..2591c48 100644
--- a/src/demo.hpp
+++ b/src/demo.hpp
@@ -10,3 +10,3 @@ class Dummy {
     public:
-    void *not_useful(char *str){useless = str;}
+        auto not_useful(char* str) -> void* { useless = str; }
 };

```


</details>
